page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: One farmer interviewed, Mr George Sproat, from Borness, farms 268 acres in this area. He rears his famous Belties along with other beef cattle and sheep. Of his 268 acres he ploughs 11.5 acres for cereal crops, uses 43 acres for silage with another 28 acres for hay, the rest is in permanent grass on which he runs 36 bullocks, 39 feeding heifers, 26 Blue Grey in calf, 9 belted bull heifers, 5 in calf heifers and 23 Belties. He also has 150 half breed ewes, 90 hogs and 190 lambs. Mr Adam Gray, from Ingleston farms 730 acres and has a dairy of 200 Fresian cows which produce 3000 litres of milk a day. The rest of his farm supports 200 beef cattle, 600 ewes, and 1000 lambs. For winter feed he grows his own silage but buys in all his hay and straw.
